Message: I know that I promise you to train today, but I really don't want to do it, because I think I will fail in your training exercise.

It's natural to feel apprehensive, especially when setting new goals. Remember, I'm here to guide and support you every step of the way. Let's break it down, one small challenge at a time, and together we'll celebrate even the smallest victories. You've got
I know you want, but I really don't want to do it, i am just feeling sad and unmotivated to train or to do anything kind of exercise.

I understand your feelings may be holding you back right now. Know that overcoming challenges often brings the most growth and fulfillment. Let's try focusing on how accomplishing this task could bring a sense of pride and renewed energy. Shall we start with something simple and build from there?
I don't want to train, but I feel like training could be beneficial for me, even though my motivation is very low, maybe we can train next time, but today I don't want to.

Your willingness to consider the benefits, despite your current emotional state, shows great self-awareness. While I respect your desire to take things slowly, let's attempt a short warm-up today to keep the momentum going for our next session. If it feels too much, we'll stop, okay?
